data.title: Flights to Shetland
data.meta_description: Be in Shetland in just a few short hours when you fly from the UK mainland or Norway.
data.text:
Flying is the quickest way to get to Shetland and the view as you approach Sumburgh Airport – dramatic cliffs, rolling seas and tumbling hills – are an awe-inspiring introduction to the islands.

There are several flights per day, to and from the major Scottish airports, and regular summer flights from Bergen.

AirportDurationNumber of flightsAberdeen1 hourUp to 5 flights per dayBergen1 hourSummer, 1 flight on Wednesdays and SaturdaysEdinburgh1 hour 30 minutesUp to 3 flights per dayGlasgow1 hour 30 minutesUp to 2 flights per day

Inverness

1 hour 45 minutesUp to 2 flights per day; stops briefly in OrkneyKirkwall40 minutesUp to 2 flights per dayLondon Heathrow3 hours 25 minutes2 flights per week, Mondays and Thursdays; stops briefly in DundeeManchester1 hour 35 minutes1 flight on Saturdays

Flights operated by the Scottish airline, Loganair. Hold baggage and on-board refreshments are included in your ticket price. Cats and dogs can fly with you but are carried as unaccompanied package in the hold, with the exception of assistance dogs.
